Restaurant Interior Design

It requires the services of experts such as Hood Builder, which has made its own mark in the field of restaurant design and remodeling. Restaurant Safety Measures

Not only can we provide you with restaurant renovation, repair, and design services, but we can maintain a safe atmosphere for years to come. We can ensure that restaurant layout design adheres to all safety and fire codes, but we don’t stop there. When it comes to your kitchen, we offer the very best HVAC hood services to keep the risk of dangerous fire to an absolute minimum.

[/vc_column_text][ultimate_spacer height="60"][vc_column_text]

HVAC Services

A large aspect of our Colorado general contracting business comes from our HVAC customers. When running a restaurant or hospitality business, you want to ensure that your atmosphere always remains cozy. After all, customers won’t visit a restaurant where the air is stuffy or where impurities tend to hang in the air. Likewise, when your HVAC system isn’t working properly, staff morale can fall and that can spell bad news for any business.

Instead, call Hood Builder to ensure that your HVAC and overall ventilation services are operating just as they should. This means that carbon dioxide, odors, and other impurities are scrubbed from the air before your HVAC system replenishes the oxygen to keep your customers happy and staff morale high.

[/vc_column_text][ultimate_spacer height="80" height_on_mob_landscape="15" height_on_mob="15"][vc_column_text]

Restaurant Plumbing Services

We maintain strict codes of conduct and work quickly to maintain and repair your restaurant plumbing services using years of training and experience.

We firmly stand behind all the products we offer and provide follow-up to ensure a completely hassle-free operation.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column css=".vc_custom_1500114527350{margin-top: 30px !important;}"][vc_column_text]

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row css=".vc_custom_1547971575259{padding-right: 20px !important;padding-left: 20px !important;}"][vc_column width="1/2"][ultimate_spacer height="50" height_on_mob_landscape="10" height_on_mob="10"][vc_column_text]

Fire Suppression Systems

Grease deposits, overheating oil and fat as well as electrical hazards are common causes of the commercial kitchen fire. To reduce the risk of fire, it is essential to keep the ventilation hood systems in good order. Our highly skilled technicians will maintain and service your kitchen hoods in an effective manner so that fire hazards can be removed. Our professional kitchen hood cleaning will prevent grease buildup and ensure the safety of your people and assets as a result. Plus, this will help you maintain a safe and comfortable working environment.

There are many aspects to commercial hood system, including cooker hoods, exhaust fans, and restaurant grease interceptors, just to name a few. We have the expertise and parts to help with all aspects of your commercial restaurant equipment, including your hood systems.

In case there is an occurrence of fire, our innovative fire prevention systems will help you control it immediately. Our installation procedures are accurate and top quality and in line with the appliance-specific needs of your food facility. Our goal is to safeguard your building against the dangers of fire so that no physician injuries and property damage happen.

We can then regularly maintain your fire suppression system or provide you with fire protection repair in order to keep your business, customers, and staff safe.

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/2"][ultimate_spacer height="50" height_on_mob_landscape="10" height_on_mob="10"][vc_column_text]

Let Us Be Your Restaurant Builder and Restaurant Maintenance Service

Your restaurant deserves to have a professional contracting service on call. That way, you can ensure that your interior design remains clean, your HVAC system is always in good working order, and your fire suppression systems are always prepared to keep everyone and everything safe.

For full operational efficiency in your foodservice facility, you should always work with expert restaurant contractors such as Hood Builder. Equipped with branded tools and equipment, we carry out each job with the utmost effectiveness and then clean up the space thoroughly for a spotless look. With our company by your side, you’ll never have a hard time maintaining your commercial kitchen as well as the dining area for a pleasurable customer experience. Whenever an exhaust fan malfunctions or there is an issue with the fire suppression system, all you need to do is give our restaurant contractors a quick phone call. We’ll respond immediately and dispatch our team of highly qualified technicians to fix the issues in a timely manner.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

We can provide you with restaurant repair to keep your business in the best condition all the year through, and we can provide you with restaurant cleaning to keep your business attractive for your clientele.

Most importantly, we can ensure your kitchen operates efficiently with hood installation and repair, fire suppression system maintenance and repair, and HVAC – heating and air condition maintenance and repair.

In short, when it comes to restaurant building, construction, remodeling, HVAC systems, fire suppression systems, ventilation hoods, or any other aspect of your business, Hood Builder is there to help. Call today and receive a free quote.

For a Full and Fast price Quote, Contact Hood Builder today at 303-777-7720.

data.post_content: [vc_row][vc_column offset="vc_col-lg-10 vc_col-md-10"][ultimate_exp_section title="Is it necessary to have my kitchen exhaust system cleaned?" cnt_bg_color="#ffffff" icon="Defaults-plus-square-o" new_icon="Defaults-minus-square-o" icon_size="20" icon_color="#a9a790" icon_hover_color="#a9a790" icon_active_color="#a9a790" extra_class="wps-faq" font_family="font_family:Montserrat|font_call:Montserrat|variant:500" heading_style="font-weight:500;" title_font_size="desktop:18px;" icon_margin="margin-right:10px;" title_padding="padding-bottom:0px;"][vc_column_text]Yes. The law states that kitchen grease exhaust cleaning must be performed on a regular basis, and the Fire Marshal, Health Inspector and your insurance company will be closely monitoring your compliance. The law isn’t set out to inconvenience you. Vent hood cleaning to remove kitchen grease prevents fire and improves air flow, leading to a safer and cleaner kitchen environment. As an added bonus, you can improve the life of your vent hoods and exhaust systems by engaging in regular cleaning and maintenance.[/vc_column_text][/ultimate_exp_section][ultimate_exp_section title="How often should I have my vent hoods cleaned?" cnt_bg_color="#ffffff" icon="Defaults-plus-square-o" new_icon="Defaults-minus-square-o" icon_size="20" icon_color="#a9a790" icon_hover_color="#a9a790" icon_active_color="#a9a790" extra_class="wps-faq" font_family="font_family:Montserrat|font_call:Montserrat|variant:500" heading_style="font-weight:500;" title_font_size="desktop:18px;" icon_margin="margin-right:10px;" title_padding="padding-bottom:0px;"][vc_column_text]At Hood Builder, we recommend that incredibly busy kitchens engage in quarterly cleaning schedules, such as those operating 24-hours per day. For moderately busy kitchens, a thorough cleaning every six months should suffice. Low-volume kitchens can get away with annual vent hood cleanings, but for kitchens that primarily use wood or coal, monthly cleanings might be best.[/vc_column_text][/ultimate_exp_section][ultimate_exp_section title="Why can’t I just rely on my employees to clean my vent hoods?" cnt_bg_color="#ffffff" icon="Defaults-plus-square-o" new_icon="Defaults-minus-square-o" icon_size="20" icon_color="#a9a790" icon_hover_color="#a9a790" icon_active_color="#a9a790" extra_class="wps-faq" font_family="font_family:Montserrat|font_call:Montserrat|variant:500" heading_style="font-weight:500;" title_font_size="desktop:18px;" icon_margin="margin-right:10px;" title_padding="padding-bottom:0px;" desc_padding="padding-top:0px;" desc_margin="margin-top:0px;"][vc_column_text]Cleaning vent hoods and the ventilation systems they’re attached to is a tedious task that requires experience, training and specialized equipment. If you employ individuals who happen to be qualified and certified, that is an ideal scenario for passing vent hood inspections and getting the most efficiency and safety from your vent hood performance. On the other hand, if you don’t employ anyone who is qualified and certified to clean kitchen ventilation systems, it pays to hire a professional team like Hood Builder to do the work for you.[/vc_column_text][/ultimate_exp_section][ultimate_exp_section title="When I hire Hood Builder to clean my kitchen, will I have to shut my business down?" cnt_bg_color="#ffffff" icon="Defaults-plus-square-o" new_icon="Defaults-minus-square-o" icon_size="20" icon_color="#a9a790" icon_hover_color="#a9a790" icon_active_color="#a9a790" extra_class="wps-faq" font_family="font_family:Montserrat|font_call:Montserrat|variant:500" heading_style="font-weight:500;" title_font_size="desktop:18px;" title_padding="padding-bottom:0px;" icon_margin="margin-right:10px;"][vc_column_text]At Hood Builder, we work around your schedule. You tell us when to clean and we’ll show up with tools in hand, ready to get the job done to your complete satisfaction.[/vc_column_text][/ultimate_exp_section][ultimate_exp_section title="Do you adhere to any standards when performing vent hood cleaning and maintenance?" cnt_bg_color="#ffffff" icon="Defaults-plus-square-o" new_icon="Defaults-minus-square-o" icon_size="20" icon_color="#a9a790" icon_hover_color="#a9a790" icon_active_color="#a9a790" extra_class="wps-faq" font_family="font_family:Montserrat|font_call:Montserrat|variant:500" heading_style="font-weight:500;" title_font_size="desktop:18px;" title_padding="padding-bottom:0px;" icon_margin="margin-right:10px;"][vc_column_text]Yes. At Hood Builder, our technicians are trained and certified in advanced cleaning systems course work as mandated by the National Fire Protection Association. The NFPA is the authority on fire, electrical and building safety protocols. When you choose Hood Builder, you can be sure that your vent hood cleaning, kitchen equipment maintenance and fire suppression system installation will adhere to the stringent standards of the NFPA and all other related associations.[/vc_column_text][/ultimate_exp_section][ultimate_exp_section title="How much do you charge for vent hood cleaning in Denver?" cnt_bg_color="#ffffff" icon="Defaults-plus-square-o" new_icon="Defaults-minus-square-o" icon_size="20" icon_color="#a9a790" icon_hover_color="#a9a790" icon_active_color="#a9a790" extra_class="wps-faq" font_family="font_family:Montserrat|font_call:Montserrat|variant:500" heading_style="font-weight:500;" title_font_size="desktop:18px;" title_padding="padding-bottom:0px;" icon_margin="margin-right:10px;"][vc_column_text]We wish we could tell you a definite figure to make the process easier to figure for your budget, but unfortunately there are several factors to consider. When determine how much to quote for a vent hood cleaning project, we take into consideration the type of system you have and the volume of work involved. However, we also guarantee that we can beat our competitors’ prices, and offer special rates to our long-term clients. We don’t want you to just use Hood Builder once. We want to return again and again to keep your vent hoods sparkling clean, your kitchen air clean, and your personnel safe from fire. Contact Hood Builder today to receive a free quote.[/vc_column_text][/ultimate_exp_section][ultimate_exp_section title="Is your work guaranteed?" cnt_bg_color="#ffffff" icon="Defaults-plus-square-o" new_icon="Defaults-minus-square-o" icon_size="20" icon_color="#a9a790" icon_hover_color="#a9a790" icon_active_color="#a9a790" extra_class="wps-faq" font_family="font_family:Montserrat|font_call:Montserrat|variant:500" heading_style="font-weight:500;" title_font_size="desktop:18px;" title_padding="padding-bottom:0px;" icon_margin="margin-right:10px;"][vc_column_text]Yes. At Hood Builder, we guarantee our work 100%. If you are not satisfied with any aspect of our work, we will remedy the situation as quickly and efficiently as possible. If you are not satisfied in any way, we will work to make the situation right at no additional cost to you. Contact us today to learn more about our satisfaction guarantee.[/vc_column_text][/ultimate_exp_section][ultimate_exp_section title="How long does it take to clean the average commercial kitchen?" cnt_bg_color="#ffffff" icon="Defaults-plus-square-o" new_icon="Defaults-minus-square-o" icon_size="20" icon_color="#a9a790" icon_hover_color="#a9a790" icon_active_color="#a9a790" extra_class="wps-faq" font_family="font_family:Montserrat|font_call:Montserrat|variant:500" heading_style="font-weight:500;" title_font_size="desktop:18px;" title_padding="padding-bottom:0px;" icon_margin="margin-right:10px;"][vc_column_text]The time our team takes to clean your exhaust system depends on the condition of the system in question. If your exhaust and vent hoods haven’t been cleaned for some time, our team may take longer to complete the job than if cleaning was performed on a regular basis. A larger kitchen will also take longer to clean than a smaller one. On average, the Hood Builder team can complete a vent hood and exhaust system cleaning in about three hours, and usually at night when your restaurant is closed for the evening.[/vc_column_text][/ultimate_exp_section][ultimate_exp_section title="Are you licensed and insured?" cnt_bg_color="#ffffff" icon="Defaults-plus-square-o" new_icon="Defaults-minus-square-o" icon_size="20" icon_color="#a9a790" icon_hover_color="#a9a790" icon_active_color="#a9a790" extra_class="wps-faq" font_family="font_family:Montserrat|font_call:Montserrat|variant:500" heading_style="font-weight:500;" title_font_size="desktop:18px;" title_padding="padding-bottom:0px;" icon_margin="margin-right:10px;"][vc_column_text]Yes. Hood Builder is fully licensed and insured for your uncompromised protection.[/vc_column_text][/ultimate_exp_section][ultimate_exp_section title="What other services can you offer?" cnt_bg_color="#ffffff" icon="Defaults-plus-square-o" new_icon="Defaults-minus-square-o" icon_size="20" icon_color="#a9a790" icon_hover_color="#a9a790" icon_active_color="#a9a790" extra_class="wps-faq" font_family="font_family:Montserrat|font_call:Montserrat|variant:500" heading_style="font-weight:500;" title_font_size="desktop:18px;" title_padding="padding-bottom:0px;" icon_margin="margin-right:10px;"][vc_column_text]Hood Builder can keep your exhaust systems clean, including all hoods, vents, fans, and duct work, as well as perform kitchen equipment maintenance and service. Our technician can also check your fire suppression systems for compliance, maintain your systems and perform regular service to keep your kitchen, equipment and personnel safe from harm at all times. To learn more about the cleaning, maintenance and installation services we offer, visit our Services page.[/vc_column_text][/ultimate_exp_section][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][ultimate_spacer height="70"][/vc_column][/vc_row]

Restaurant design services are necessary for completing all aspects of a restaurant’s design. From evaluating the most ideal location to evaluating the building and drawing up plans for the full restaurant construction project, Hood Builder is the company to call. 

[/vc_column_text][ultimate_spacer height="60" height_on_mob_landscape="40" height_on_mob="40"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][ultimate_spacer height="90" height_on_mob_landscape="70" height_on_mob="70"][/vc_column][vc_column offset="vc_col-lg-7 vc_col-md-7"][vc_column_text]

Affordable Pricing, Quality Restaurant Remodeling & Design Services

We have worked with some of the biggest brands in the restaurant industry today, including Olive Garden, McDonald’s, Burger King, and Applebee’s. These establishments know that quality design, reliable construction, and eye-catching aesthetic appeal is what sets an eatery apart. Now, it’s your restaurant’s turn.  Get affordable pricing, quality service, and all the restaurant design services you need to get your operation running at optimum performance. That is just what you’ll get when you work with Hood Builder. Contact us for a free quote.

Restaurant Construction

The construction of your restaurant is extremely important to us. As restaurant designers and experienced builders, we specialize in all aspects of any given restaurant design-build project. 

Location: 

Your grand opening could be beautiful, but few will enjoy your new menu offerings unless you have an ideal location. Our restaurant design firm will help you pick out a spot that draws plenty of foot traffic to keep business steady for years to come.

 

Building Evaluations:

Our restaurant contractors and build specialists will perform a thorough analysis of your building, including all wiring, plumbing, foundational work, and everything else. Your restaurant can only be successful when the building is sound, and only the most reliable buildings will do for our customers.

 

Building & Exterior Drawings: 

Our architects and interior designers can draw up the ideal plans for any aspect of your restaurant, including kitchen drawings, dining room drawings, seating drawings, and exterior drawings. We can even draw up parking lot plans, as well as help you secure all permits and planning for sized restaurant services project.

 

Restaurant Construction: 

We can handle every aspect of your restaurant design-build project, including managing the project, breaking ground, performing interior design, and all the rest.

4 Things to Look for in a Restaurant Remodeling Contractor  

Signage & Landscaping: 

Our restaurant signage and landscaping artists will ensure customers find your curb action extra appealing. We can beautify your exterior to match your restaurant interior design to create an establishment that customers will love to step into.

 

Commercial Kitchen Layouts & Equipment: 

We can make sure your commercial kitchen layout is efficient and safe. Appliances will be placed just so for maximum energy savings, and routes designed so that your cooks and servers can do their jobs without obstacles.

 

Restaurant Cleaning & Maintenance

Opening day is exciting, but from then on, your restaurant must be cleaned and maintained to establish the same high levels of customer appeal.

Wall Repairs: 

If there are defects on the walls, we’ll find them and repair them fast. We can do our best to perform all interior renovations without customers present, but we’ll ensure a clean and efficient job if we do have to perform work while you’re open.

 

Stainless Steel Ceiling Repair:

Protect your restaurant from the elements with expert stainless-steel ceiling repair. We perform all restaurant repairs with long-lasting materials that won’t break the bank, helping you get quality work that stays within budget.

 

Restaurant Remodels: 

When your restaurant has a significant amount of wear and tear, it might be time for a restaurant remodeling project. That is where we excel. We can take your designs for a restaurant makeover and bring them to life while keeping to your timeframe and budget.

10 Creative Tips for Remodeling Your Restaurant.  

Commercial Kitchen Janitorial Services: 

If restaurant cleaning is in order, our janitorial staff will ensure that your kitchen areas and dining rooms remain spotless, even after the busiest shifts. We offer one-time cleaning or regular janitorial services each night to ensure that your reputation remains stellar among the neighborhood clientele. With our help, you will have no trouble keeping the health inspector at bay.

  Do you need restaurant services in Denver, Colorado? Call Hood builder, where we guarantee that your patrons will love dining in. Not only that, but your customers are bound to tell all their friends and family what a great environment you’ve created, thanks to our restaurant design company’s expertise and quality of work.  Want a local establishment you can be proud of? For a full, fast and honest price quote, contact Hood Builder today at 303-777-7720.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column offset="vc_col-lg-offset-1 vc_col-lg-4 vc_col-md-offset-1 vc_col-md-4"][vc_wp_custommenu nav_menu="9" el_class="wps-sidebar-related-links" title="Related Links"][templatera id="192"][/vc_column][vc_column][ultimate_spacer height="90" height_on_mob_landscape="70" height_on_mob="70"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width="wps-full-width"][vc_column][templatera id="96"][/vc_column][/vc_row]

An HVAC ventilation system is designed to expel odors, stale air, and other gasses out of your commercial kitchen space. When the air is clean, your staff can work in a healthier space, and this alone can improve productivity.

Free Quote 303-777-7720

[/vc_column_text][ultimate_spacer height="60" height_on_mob_landscape="40" height_on_mob="40"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][ultimate_spacer height="90" height_on_mob_landscape="70" height_on_mob="70"][/vc_column][vc_column offset="vc_col-lg-7 vc_col-md-7"][vc_column_text]Your customers, too, deserve a dining area where the air is filtered, allowing them to breathe easy while they enjoy your many culinary delights. When visitors come to a restaurant, the very first thing they look for is a healthy and hygienic environment. No matter how good the food is, if the place is not well-ventilated, it will take a toll on your business. Whether it is the kitchen or the dining area, it is your duty to make the areas safe for workers and guests. This is exactly where the role of HVAC ventilation systems comes in. In a large commercial kitchen, the biggest challenge is to get rid of the heat, smoke and contaminated air on a constant basis. Installation of a modern HVAC system will ensure that your kitchen as well as the dining area remains free from hot and contaminated air and provides a comfortable environment for everyone in the building. However, you should only rely on highly experienced and certified technicians when it comes to HVAC ventilation system installation and repair. Based on the specific location, size and the type of cooking done in your kitchen, you will need to invest in the most suitable and high quality HVAC system.

Full-Service Ventilation Services

At Hood Builder, our expert technicians are certified to fabricate, sell, install, and service high-quality ventilation systems for all types of restaurants in Denver, Colorado. We only utilize the highest quality materials, and all our systems are designed to fit within your budget. Whether you operate a commercial kitchen, dining facility, cafeteria, community kitchen or food service establishment, feel confident that our company will first conduct a proper assessment of your specific needs and then recommend the most ideal solution to fulfill those day-to-day needs. We take pride in offering and installing high-quality ventilation systems. Over the years, we have built durable upblast fans, utility fans, and ventilators that get the job done every time. It is due to our extensive experience that we quickly understand the specific needs of a client and then design or customize an HVAC ventilation system that keeps the entire facility safe and comfortable. Our roof sidewall discharge and upblast fans offer high durability and performance and have been tested for all grease-prone applications. Our sidewall and upblast discharge fans can be configured with a variety of accessories to address the myriad challenges faced in the commercial kitchen. Once you have our highly trained technicians by your side, you will be able to address all the concerns in a proper and correct manner. Our ventilators will keep your space contaminant-free, keeping staff and customers comfortable for hours on end. Most of all, these systems will enhance the safety of people and keep illnesses at bay.

Ventilation System Repair and Cleaning

Every HVAC ventilation system requires cleaning and maintenance. Over time, an HVAC system can get clogged and cause different types of issues. If you plan your system to run at the maximum level of efficiency without any issues, you should give it proper and timely maintenance. At Hood Builder, we do not only install a wide range of HVAC systems, but also provide their repair and cleaning services.  When it comes to repairing or cleaning an HVAC ventilation system, DIY techniques are never a good idea. Though your system requires repair, balancing and cleaning, you should also make sure it stays in the best possible shape. That is exactly why you should seek the help of professional HVAC technicians and schedule the cleaning of kitchen exhaust ducts and air ducts with them. In this way, you will keep your system in an excellent shape as well as extend the lifespan of the system, while saving a lot of money in maintenance in the long term.

Air Balancing Service

The contaminated air inside a commercial kitchen needs to be pulled out. At the same time, fresh air from outside should be pulled in to replace the emptied air. This is one of the key roles of an HVAC ventilation system. In fact, the system should perform air balancing in an accurate manner, so that neither positive nor negative pressure is created inside the restaurant kitchen. Air balancing refers to an optimization of an HVAC system, so that the kitchen area remains cool and comfortable.  At Hood Builder in Denver, CO, we specialize in air balancing of all types and sizes of HVAC ventilation systems. Our technicians are expertly trained in working with all sizes of duct openings in restaurants. The best practice for restaurant owners is to get air balancing done at the interval of every two years, or as per the specific requirements or issues that may arise with a system. We follow the entire HVAC air balancing procedure with a great deal of attention while focusing on each step. Right from conducting all the preliminary checks, measuring air quantities and measuring the flow from one terminal to another to finally balancing the flow rates across all terminals, our technicians will carry out the entire procedure with the highest level of accuracy. After the task is over, our professionals will recheck and measure all key values such as fan rpm, static pressure, air flow and air temperature, room temperature for HVAC system efficiency.

Get Your HVAC Ventilation System Built and Installed in Denver, Colorado

Hood Builder has you covered when you need quality ventilators for your commercial business. First, we will conduct an assessment of your facility and then recommend the most suited HVAC ventilation system for installation, consisting of one or more fan systems as per your specific need. We will then install the HVAC ventilation system exactly as per the measurements taken earlier. Our goal is to outfit your facility with the most ideal system and maintain it in a way that eliminates any downtime. If you are in search of an HVAC system that fulfills the specific requirements of your commercial kitchen or restaurant, you should head over to Hood Builder. Based in Denver, CO, we cater to the ventilation needs of a wide variety of restaurants and cooking facilities. For your free consultation and fast price quote, you can call our office phone number or write us an email using the contact form.

Criteria for Selection of HVAC Units

While it is crucial to invest in energy-efficient HVAC components, it is also important to choose the right type of heating and air-conditioning units for your commercial kitchen, restaurant, dining facility, cafeteria, etc. A restaurant or dining facility has a heating and cooling requirement for the entire year. Whether it is heating or air-conditioning, the HVAC system you install should do its job in a highly efficient manner. Since all HVAC components are not the same, you need to install and use a system that is ideal for the kind of commercial facility you operate so that energy costs remain economical. Key criteria for selecting the most appropriate type of HVAC units for your restaurant or commercial kitchen are as follows:

Aesthetics:

The layout of the HVAC components you install should be a good match for the layout of your kitchen. The units should be installed in a way that blends them with the overall décor of the restaurant in an unobtrusive manner. At the same time, the heating and cooling components should maximize space rather than minimize the space inside the facility. That is exactly why the aesthetics of the HVAC components you invest in is of utmost importance.

Energy Efficiency:

It is crucial to consider the energy efficiency of the HVAC units you outfit your kitchen with. If you have a large kitchen, the units will operate for several hours at a time. If the units consume an excessive amount of energy, the total running costs of the system will shoot up. Always invest in heating components that can operate at very low temperatures.

Split System or Packaged:

There are many types of heating and air-conditioning units available for commercial facilities. If you choose to install the split system type, one or more units can be placed inside the facility and one outside the facility. The two units can then be linked using pipework. On the other hand, packaged heating and cooling systems come with a single unit that is placed inside the facility. Split system heating units offer a high level of energy efficiency. The installation procedures for different types of units also vary. It is best to consult an HVAC system specialist to determine what is ideal for your restaurant. Based on these criteria, you will be able to choose the most ideal heating and cooling units for the type of commercial facility you run. We are of the firm belief that a well-performing ventilation hood will provide a cleaner working environment for your staff, a warm and cozy space for your patrons, and immense savings on energy costs.

Restaurant Ventilation Hoods Services

The ultimate challenge for a restaurant is to deliver a remarkable experience to its patrons and guests. While you must have done a great deal of planning to prepare high-quality food, you can never ignore the specific ventilation needs of the restaurant. Vent hood systems are not just essential, but they should also be planned and set up in a way that enhances the air quality. A comfortable atmosphere inside the kitchen, as well as the dining area, is necessary to please visitors and staff alike. That is exactly why you need to pay utmost attention to the design of the commercial kitchen exhaust hoods and how it coordinates with the HVAC. There is truly much more to the ventilation hoods than you might have thought. Whether you already operate a restaurant or plan to remodel an existing one, adequate attention must be paid to exhaust hoods.

Hood Builder: The Ideal Destination for Exhaust Hoods Services

At Hood Builder, we have been providing commercial businesses with ventilation hoods for over 25 years. We are of the firm belief that a well-performing ventilation hood will provide a cleaner working environment for your staff, a warm and cozy space for your patrons, and immense savings on energy costs. Comprehensive research and development is the foundation of our ventilation hoods services for restaurants. Our insightful knowledge and experience in this industry allow us to carefully match the vent hood systems with the operation of your kitchen. In a large restaurant with a great deal of cooking and food preparation on a daily basis, you also need to stay compliant with the building codes. To deal with a large amount of heat and smoke and reduce fire hazards, you will need to outfit your food facility with an exhaust hood with fire suppression. This will ensure the dangers of fire are minimized and the staff does their jobs in a healthy work environment and your guests remain safe from physical injuries due to fire. Removal of grease is important not just to minimize the risk of fire, but also for ensuring a clean and hygienic atmosphere in the restaurant. Our team of highly trained and skilled technicians has a vast knowledge of how different types of vent hoods work and which one is ideal for your needs.

Vent Hoods for Cleaner Air

The purpose of installing the vent hoods is to maintain better air quality inside the kitchen and the dining area. The heat and smoke need proper removal through well-laid-out ducts. Balancing the airflow is not an easy feat. The job requires expert skills and extensive experience in the field. For your hood to function properly, every aspect of the construction and installation phase must work together, from the design and fabrication to the construction to the installation process. When done correctly, your vent hoods will ensure that your kitchen runs efficiently and healthily from open to close.

Why Hood Builder is Different

First, our specialists will inspect your facility to take the key measurements of the space and then develop the proposed design after a detailed discussion with you. Then, we will start working on the ventilation design to smartly engineer a vent hood system, which is the right match for your facility.

We Install the Right Vent Hoods for Your Needs

We install all types of hoods including both Type I and Type II, and all of our ventilation systems are installed in a fire-safe area of the kitchen to prevent accidents. When looking for exhaust hoods for your own kitchen, you must have come across these vent hood types. What is important is to understand how one type of vent hood differs from the other and select the hood system which is an exact match for the specific needs of your commercial kitchen or restaurant. Whether you should install Type 1 or Type 2 depends on the kind of cooking and food preparation you do in the kitchen. So, first of all, you should check out the appliances you use. Type 1 has been designed to be installed in food facilities where cooking activities produce grease and smoke on a regular basis. So, this type of vent hood also includes a fire protection system. On the other hand, the Type 2 vent hoods are suited to spaces where cooking produces only heat and steam. Apart from this, there are multiple other things that you need to take into account to choose the most suitable exhaust hood for your food facility. For example, hood design, exhaust rate, and the physical size of the vent hoods are important considerations when you are going to fit your kitchen with a ventilation system. With our vent hood experts at your service, you can feel confident that your restaurant will get the most ideal and the highest quality of ventilation system for the safety and comfort of your staff and guests.

The Ventilation Design

The design of the kitchen exhaust hoods and the ventilation is equally important. The technician will consider the size and shape as well the length of the ducting runs to the outside. Plus, how the ducting will bend for maximum efficiency of the entire ventilation system is a key concern. For example, if the ducting has longer runs and more bends, the kitchen will need a higher exhaust rate per minute. A lower exhaust rate will only mean less exhaust air will be removed. This, in turn, will take its toll on the air quality inside the kitchen as well as the dining area. Experts pay special attention to ‘makeup air’ when developing the design of the vent hood system. As the exhaust hood removes contaminated air from the kitchen, the removed air needs to be replaced with clean and fresh air from outside. That is exactly where makeup air plays a crucial role. To ensure proper air balance, the design has to be perfect. Hood Builder is a trusted name in the ventilation hoods industry with several years of proven restaurant experience. Our experts will perform the task considering all the key factors to ensure better air quality.

Get in Touch with Our Vent Hood Specialists

Since the food Service industry regulations require a higher standard of air quality than most buildings, Hood Builder will ensure that you get exactly what you expect – the best ventilation system for proper airflow and disposal. For kitchen ventilation hoods that are regulation-compliant, efficient, and built to last, Hood Builder should be your first and only choice.

Proper ventilation is essential for all kinds of kitchens. If you run a large or commercial kitchen, keeping it well-ventilated becomes even more important for the health and safety of employees and guests. That is exactly why restaurants install an exhaust hood system, commonly called range hood. If you have outfitted your facility with this system, you need to abide by the “make up air” codes, among many other codes that the NFPA has outlined in great detail. Cooking and food preparation fills a large kitchen with plenty of smoky and hot air. While this air needs fast removal, the HVAC system also needs to replace it with fresh air from outside. That is exactly where the role of makeup air gains importance for commercial facility owners.

At the Hood Builder in Denver, CO, we specialize in exhaust hood makeup air services for a wide range of commercial kitchens, restaurants, dining facilities, cafeterias and food preparation facilities.

[/vc_column_text][ultimate_spacer height="60" height_on_mob_landscape="40" height_on_mob="40"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][ultimate_spacer height="90" height_on_mob_landscape="70" height_on_mob="70"][/vc_column][vc_column offset="vc_col-lg-7 vc_col-md-7"][vc_column_text]

Problems Due to Low Air Replacement

As a restaurant owner or manager, it is your utmost duty to keep the entire building safe against health and fire hazards. That is exactly why the NFPA requires you to adhere to the building codes. By staying code-compliant, you will provide a healthy and safe environment for the occupants of the commercial building or the facility. As per some building codes, you will need to install a makeup air unit, particularly if your exhaust hood has a capacity of over 600 CFM. If you plan for adequate ventilation in the building, hood makeup air is essential for you. This helps with the replacement of the air that is removed in your commercial kitchen through an exhaust hood system. When your facility has low air replacement, it builds negative pressure that creates an unsafe working environment. Not just that, this pressure can also create many issues with the range hood. For example, the hood fan can malfunction as a result of the negative pressure created in the building. In large and busy kitchens, the HVAC system cannot handle air replacement in a proper manner. Hood makeup air is an ideal solution to this problem. The makeup air unit functions to bring in additional air in order to replace the lost air in the kitchen. In simple terms, the makeup air unit creates equality between the amount of air lost and the amount of air brought in. At the Hood Builder, we have been serving a large number of restaurants and commercial kitchens with code-compliant and NFPA-approved makeup air units all across Denver. Our makeup hoods also carry the approval of NSF, ETL, and UL among others.

How to Know If You Need Makeup Air

Based on the scenarios you have in your commercial kitchen, you will be able to know whether a makeup air unit is required. You will need makeup air if:
  • The exhaust hood has a pulling capacity of 1200+ CFM
  • Your kitchen has poor ventilation
  • The building codes necessitate the use of the device
  • Your exhaust hood operates for several hours
A common misconception among many facility owners is that powerful HVAC systems eliminate the need for makeup air. In fact, the more powerful an exhaust hood you have, the greater the need for using a makeup air unit. It is not actually about how powerful your range hood is, what really matters is whether the space in your restaurant or kitchen is adequately ventilated. If your kitchen does not have plenty of moving air, a makeup air unit is ideal for improving ventilation in a drastic manner. Once installed, the unit will pull in an ample amount of clean and fresh air as the exhaust hood removes the hot,  grease-contaminated air from the kitchen. The vent hood gathers the cooking exhaust and propels it through the ducting outside your facility. If your exhaust hood runs for several hours at a time, thE contaminated air will be continuously removed from the kitchen. This, in turn, creates a need to have more fresh air from outside in order to fill in the amount of lost air. You may need to use a makeup air unit even as per what the building code in your area requires. For detailed information in this regard, don’t hesitate to reach out to one of our exhaust hood specialists at the Hood Builder.

What the Makeup Air Unit Includes

Also referred to as a makeup air hood, the unit or kit has a range hood damper and air pressure sensor as its key components. Each of these is there to perform a specific function. Our HVAC technicians have a sound knowledge of all kinds of makeup air units and how they work.  The makeup air unit is attached to the ductwork of the range hood. It has a pressure switch that tells the exhaust hood damper when to get active and pull in fresh and clean air into the facility. The role of the air pressure sensor is to control and maintain proper airflow into the kitchen. Once the device has been correctly installed, you will have quality air balance and flow. Proper ventilation will improve the quality of indoor air and create a healthy and safe environment.

Get in Touch for High Quality Makeup Air Unit

Made of stainless steel, our makeup air hoods are highly proficient in the removal of smoke, odor, and grease and fill the lost air with clean and fresh air from outside the commercial facility. Once you have our makeup air kit in your commercial kitchen, you can forget about negative air pressure. Each of our makeup air units is designed with 430 stainless steel, polished to a pristine shine. Additionally, our products are open drip-proof, and weather-proof. For commercial kitchens, restaurants, cafeterias, and dining facilities, this makeup unit is ideal in terms of functionality, design, and longevity. At Hood Builder, we provide makeup air systems in various capacities starting from 2000 CFM to 5,500 CFM. To find out more about our makeup air units and their features, give our office in Denver, CO, a phone call or write us an email.

Reduce Heat Buildup:

Restaurant kitchen & Commercial Hood Cleaning in Denver, CO

Commercial kitchens that have been in use for some time accumulate grease on most surfaces, but particularly on the exhaust and ventilation systems. The grease has to be cleaned periodically to enable your system to work efficiently. If this is not done, you may have a fire hazard on your hands, which you most certainly do not want. If you operate a commercial kitchen or a restaurant, you should remain aware of the massive risk of fire due to the hidden deposits of grease in the exhaust hood or the range hood and get rid of it in a timely manner. The National Fire Protection Association reports that more than 11,000 fires happen in commercial kitchens every year.  The amount of property damage amounts to more than $150 million, and one of the leading causes of those fires is grease catching fire that accumulates in the kitchen exhaust hood and exhaust systems. This means that commercial hood cleaning is an essential requirement. Hoodbuilder is a professional hood cleaning service in Denver, Colorado. We have been the staple cleaner for many well-known commercial kitchens, and we want to be the same for your facility too.

Hood Cleaning Service & Inspections – Commercial Grease Cleaner

In our cleaning process, we adhere to the cleaning guidelines outlined by the National Fire Protection Association. We use hot water pressure washing and polish after we are done to keep your hoods looking pristine.  After the job has been done, we’ll leave our certification sticker on your hood for easy identification by inspectors in Denver, Co. The cleaning of the kitchen hood and vents is a messy task, which should always be performed by qualified professionals. First of all, our team of grease cleaners will clear out the area around the exhaust hood. This includes disconnecting the electrical power to cooking equipment and gas lines. Once the area has been cleared and the electrical connections in that area have been turned off, the cleaning procedure begins. Whether it is the hood canopy, the ductwork, or the exhaust fans, our professionals properly clean every area, inside and outside, and collect all the grease deposits using the latest tools and techniques. After the exhaust hood system has been power-washed and cleaned, the kitchen surface will have water and residue all over. So, our professionals will continue the cleaning procedure to eliminate all the oil and fat residue and debris from every area to have a fully functional and clean kitchen.

Why You Should Keep the Restaurant Kitchen Hood Clean

In a commercial kitchen, the range hood consistently gathers a lot of dirt, grease, and grime as well as contaminated air flowing through the system. Getting rid of all of this offers a number of benefits.

Improved Airflow:

Grease and grime deposits contaminated the air inside the kitchen. Over time, the airflow in the kitchen deteriorates in quality. As a result of this, it becomes quite difficult for the staff to work comfortably. Such an unhealthy environment also takes a toll on the other areas of the commercial kitchen. Professional hood cleaning helps you avoid all these issues.

Reduce the Risk of Fire:

At all times, you need to keep your kitchen well-protected from fire hazards. The consistent buildup of grease increases the risk of a kitchen fire. If the cleaning of the range hoods is ignored or delayed, it can lead to serious consequences for the staff as well as guests. The accountability for the accident will always remain with you, the restaurant owner.  Therefore, it is crucial to hire commercial hood cleaning services as per a frequency that is ideal for your commercial kitchen.

Grease-related Falls:

Oil, fats, and grease also make the kitchen surface slippery. This increases the risk of slips and falls for the workers in the kitchen as well as anyone who enters this space. Proper hood cleaning will help you keep the kitchen area grease-free and avoid any type of accidents.

Stay Code-Compliant:

The NFPA has outlined clear safety guidelines for commercial kitchens and restaurants to follow. As a responsible business owner, you should always adhere to these codes to operate your facility in a safe and healthy environment and have the law on your side.

Save Money:

One key benefit of kitchen hood cleaning is that you will be able to save a lot of money in the long term. Imagine what could happen, if the grease deposits in your facility are not removed. This can lead to potential fire breakouts and damages to both lives and property. Proper cleaning also prolongs the lifespan of the range hood system and other equipment.

Let Us Help You Select the Right Cleaning Frequency

Among other things, the National Fire Protection Association also recommends how many times you should clean the exhaust hood of your kitchen in a month or year. Make sure you pick the right frequency. At Hood Builder, our professionals will guide and advise you in this aspect as well. The cleaning frequency that is right for you depends on a number of things such as whether you use solid fuel and the volume of cooking that is performed in your kitchen on a daily basis. Monthly cleaning is ideal for those restaurants that use wood, coal, or charcoal as fuel. If you do not use solid fuel but have a high volume of cooking, you should get the range hood cleaned on a quarterly basis. Commercial kitchens with a moderate volume of cooking should get the cleaning done on a semi-annual basis to keep the working environment safe. No matter what type of fuel you use or how much cooking is done in your kitchen, our professionals will educate you on the cleaning aspect and help you choose the most ideal frequency of cleaning.

Fire Suppression System Drawing Services

Successful installation of a fire suppression system requires a great deal of planning by highly qualified professionals. This includes developing a blueprint for setting up all the components of the fire protection system in accordance with the kitchen layout and the positioning of the cooking appliances. A fire protection drawing includes all the crucial details of how the entire system will be installed for proper functioning and maximum efficiency. It is diagrammatic information, which restaurant contractors use to get started with the installation of the complete range of the fire protection systems. At Hood Builder, we provide professional drawing services for all kinds of reputed fire suppression systems, meant to safeguard your business and people against the risk of fire. The drawing is based on the specific needs of a food facility including its size and location. If the conceptual information is planned in a correct manner, the entire installation project will be performed smoothly to deliver the best level of fire protection. Hood Builder has specialization in developing design blueprints for a wide range of fire suppression systems including:
  • Automatic fire sprinkler systems
  • Pressurized gas extinguishing systems
  • Chemical foam suppression system
  • Water-based fire protection systems
We have an expert team of engineers and designers who are quite well-versed in the drawing of fire suppression systems from a number of reputed brands such as Ansul, Range Guard, Amerex, Pyrochem, etc. Our extensive experience enables us to consider every crucial aspect as well as the smallest details of the design. Our company has a solid reputation for providing fast and accurate drawings to start the kitchen fire system installation in a correct manner. Our team of engineers has specialization in hydraulic calculations, pipe isometrics, stock lists, and sprinkler design. Most of all, our professionals strictly adhere to all jurisdictional requirements. Our drawing precision makes the fire system installation both swift and cost-effective.

Why Clients Like to Work with Us

Once you have our team of specialists by your side, you don’t have to worry about any aspect of the kitchen fire system installation. That is exactly why most business owners in Denver, CO, head over to our office for all tasks related to the proper installation of a top-quality fire protection system. A fire prevention system installation project involves a lot of complexities, which need expert handling. Apart from drawing the entire arrangement of the system, audits and surveys should be conducted to stay compliant with fire safety codes. The construction documents need to be prepared in a proper manner. At Hood Builder, we take care of every aspect that the installation involves. Our restaurant services are designed to give the best results and peace of mind. If you already have a fire sprinkler system installed in your food facility, we can assess its quality and upgrade it as per your requirement. We also perform a thorough inspection and prepare reports based on the same to give you a clear idea of what the system lacks and what it needs for higher efficiency. We deal in only the most efficient and top-quality fire suppression systems. The design of these systems is created by our expert craftsmen and designers, who carry tons of experience under the belt.

Let our experts create the design blueprint for your kitchen fire suppression system. Restaurant Plumbing Services

No commercial kitchen is fully ready for food preparation until it has an adequate supply of water and a fully functional drainage system. For any large restaurant to operate with maximum productivity, its plumbing has to be strong. A commercial kitchen is a hub of activities including cooking, food preparation, dishwashing, steam sanitization, etc. All these operations can run smoothly only when the plumbing design and installation have been done in an effective manner. That is exactly why every large food facility owner requires commercial plumbing services. Ignoring proper plumbing in a large restaurant or kitchen will only take its toll on the working environment and slow down operation. So, make sure you pay serious attention to this aspect of your business.

Hood Builder: Your Ideal Commercial Plumbing Partner

Hood Builder delivers quality commercial plumbing services to organizations like yours across the country. Our plumbing technicians are highly-trained, professional, and personable. Using the very best equipment and materials, we can get any sized job done quickly and to your exact specifications. Whether you need a simple faucet installed or a complete sewer line replaced, Hood Builder can provide you with a wide range of commercial plumbing services to meet your growing needs.
  • Drain cleaning
  • Water heater installation
  • Water leak detection
  • Water leak repairs
  • Toilet and faucet installation
  • Faulty plumbing systems
  • Clogged drain lines
  • And more
We have a client-first mentality, which means that we strive to provide the best customer service on your budget and always on time. We treat your location with respect, we keep you informed every step of the way, and we never hit you with hidden charges. What you see is what you get, and that’s plumbing expertise fast when you need it for a hassle-free business operation.

Gas Lines for Commercial Kitchen

A restaurant is a place where a variety of food is prepared and served. Cooking and food preparation continue for hours on end to fulfill the orders of guests in an efficient manner. For this reason, a commercial kitchen needs to be outfitted with a well-laid network of gas lines. When installing gas lines, it is essential to complete the setup as per the specific daily needs of the kitchen. On top of that, the installation needs to be carried out keeping the possible future expansion in mind. If the gas line system is not flexible, you will end up wasting a lot of money getting it all removed and laying out the system afresh. By hiring commercial plumbing services, you will be able to have the entire project completed in a strategic and futuristic manner.

New Plumbing Installations

Setting up a new restaurant is a complicated process, which involves many different types of installations to be performed properly. To make a good impact on customers and keep the staff happy, business owners should install new toilets and accessories in the kitchen in a way that seamlessly blends with the overall interior design of the food facility or restaurant. Commercial plumbers understand the water supply, sinks, and faucets requirements better than anyone else. They carry out all these installations to make sure plumbing functions steadily and smoothly.

Drainage System Installation

Waste management in a commercial restaurant is a critical concern. If you operate a large kitchen or a food facility, you will need to deal with a great deal of waste on a daily basis. Unless you have properly installed sewers and drains, productivity will be affected and your business will suffer. By hiring a commercial plumbing service, you will ensure proper and accurate plumbing installation. If the sewers and drains function efficiently, the risk of blockages in the system will be minimized. When building a large restaurant, drainage should always remain a top priority. For the drains and sewers to work properly, their installation needs to be done in the perfect location. Effective drainage is of utmost importance to keep the restaurant atmosphere hygienic as well as ensure that everything operates in the facility exactly as it should.

Grease Traps Installation

A crucial part of restaurant plumbing is the installation of grease traps. This will help avoid blockages in the drainage system. The primary water drainage system often gets blocked due to the solid waste that might travel down the piping. That is why commercial plumbing specialists install grease traps below sinks throughout the kitchen and the dining area. The grease traps effectively capture solid waste and oily waste materials and prevent drainage blockages as a result. A commercial kitchen is fitted with another system to manage this type of waste and thus ensures uninterrupted operation.

Plumbing Maintenance and Repair

While it is crucial to get the plumbing in your commercial restaurant installed by experts, you should also give the entire system proper maintenance on a weekly basis with the help of restaurant plumbers. In a large, busy kitchen, issues with the gas lines, sewers, and drains do happen from time to time. If you plan to run your foodservice business in a hassle-free manner, you should seek the help of plumbers to give your plumbing weekly maintenance and repair minor issues as soon as they arise. Do not hire ordinary plumbers though, as they lack professional experience and in-depth knowledge of how the entire plumbing network in a large restaurant or kitchen functions. For top-notch service, hire only professional restaurant plumbers to carry out the job.

Talk to Our Restaurant Plumbing Specialists

The moment you call Hood Builder for any size of plumbing job, we will send our trained technicians to your location. We diagnose problems fast and fix them efficiently using premium parts and a trained eye for detail. When our technicians are done, the job will be left clean and organized, just how our guys found it. We continue to work with some of the biggest names in business, including Starbucks, 3M, and British Airways. As our clients, you will begin to prefer us for our affordable pricing, prompt service, and quality workmanship. Don’t let any plumbing problem get you down. Call Hood Builder plumbers, and we’ll get your problem taken care of quickly and right on time.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column offset="vc_col-lg-offset-1 vc_col-lg-4 vc_col-md-offset-1 vc_col-md-4"][vc_wp_custommenu nav_menu="12" el_class="wps-sidebar-related-links" title="Related Links"][templatera id="192"][/vc_column][vc_column][ultimate_spacer height="90" height_on_mob_landscape="70" height_on_mob="70"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width="wps-full-width"][vc_column][templatera id="96"][/vc_column][/vc_row]

Structural Engineering Services

The design of the foundational structure and the load-bearing elements of a building requires deep expertise. Before the construction of a commercial restaurant or building begins, a team of structural engineers designs the ‘bones’ of a facility to ensure sustainability and energy efficiency. These professionals do not only have expertise in viable support system design, but they also have familiarity with a range of codes and regulatory guidelines. If you are planning to construct a new commercial building or remodel an existing facility, you should always seek the help of a highly competent team of structural engineers. What the eyes see is the appearance of the building. Behind this remains hidden the supporting structure, which includes the foundation, beams, columns, walls, slabs, and many other elements to hold up the weight. Structural engineering plays a crucial role in giving a building the supporting strength it needs to stand the test of time. Make sure you get this project done by expert professionals.

Hood Builder: Your Most Trusted Structural Engineering Partner

Hood Builder is one of the leading providers of engineering and surveying services to clients in a variety of industries nationwide. Our experienced and friendly engineers and designers will bring your vision to life while making your satisfaction their top priority. While you have our team of experts by your side, you will never have to worry about a thing that the entire process involves. Equipped with comprehensive design experience and deep knowledge of local industry standards, we help a wide range of clients in accomplishing preliminary and detailed structural engineering projects in a professional manner. Innovative thinking, consistent training, and deep research are some of the key drivers that make our engineering and design services one of their kind. Our structural engineering services follow international quality standards and aim to reduce project schedules while maintaining the budgetary needs of clients. Our experience ranges from small commercial facilities to large-scale structural projects. We provide each of our clients with smartly engineered structures using new-age methodologies. We have locations across the country, so no matter where you are located, call Hood Builder and we will get to work quickly. Our engineers and designers can perform any service you require, and they work quickly with extreme attention to detail.

Full-Service Structural Engineering and Designing

  • Building design
  • Building performance analysis
  • Sustainability design
  • Condition assessments and rehabilitation
  • Project management
  • Property inspections
  • Land planning
  • Architectural services
For over 25 years, our engineers have been collaborating with building owners, architects, and builders to design premium solutions for projects of all types and sizes. Our team of seasoned professionals will use their combined years of experience and sophisticated tools to exceed your expectations.

Structural Analysis

This is a crucial part of a building construction project. Our team of experts will carry out an effective analysis of each element that comprises the overall structure of a commercial facility of building. Whether it is the columns, beams, walls or any other supporting structure, we will carefully review each of these and how they will behave when they undergo different kinds of forces.

Preliminary Structural Designs

Our structural engineers have multiple years of experience in the evaluation of a wide range of primary structural systems and select only those systems that will provide maximum support and strength to a building. The entire process involves creating the preliminary foundation layout, analyzing all the member sizes, and establishing the sizes that are most ideal for the project. This is the stage where engineers select the general project location and come up with innovative design concepts on which to build upon. Our professionals will conduct the entire review process following the best standards of quality. From drawings and the assessment of floor vibration to identifying cost elements in structural, our engineers will complete each stage carefully and provide architects with the correct input on various architectural elements. While good preliminary designs include all this, we will go the extra mile to deliver top-quality results.

Detailed Structural Designs

The structure is constructed needs to have stability and strength. The detailed design stage involves analyzing the rigidity of the structure based on the type and quality of materials used. Our structural engineering team has a deep understanding of how different types of materials perform and selects the materials in accordance with the physical requirements of the building being constructed. They create the final design of all the structural elements involved, both primary and secondary. Whether it is the plan, elevations or sections, feel confident that our engineers’ team will define and design every detail including the connection forces, construction sequences, positions of control, and reinforcing in an accurate manner.

Design for Building Foundation System

For long-term stability, it is crucial to select the right type of foundation to support the building. That is why engineers need to consider a number of factors such as the location of the structure, type of structure, load magnitude, ground conditions, etc. In many site locations, the ground conditions are not favorable. Experts need to assess all of these and create a foundational design for the building in accordance with code compliance issues and seismic concerns. Our experienced engineers and draftsmen will develop the most efficient design for a highly stable and strong foundation. They will complete the process while adhering to all the building codes and regulations. Read More: Restaurant Remodel Tips: 10 Creative Tips you should know  

Focused on Your Complete Satisfaction

We have worked with some of the biggest names in business today, including Starbucks, McDonald’s, and The Olive Garden. Like our other clients, you will begin to prefer us for the quality of work we provide, the affordability of our pricing, and the fact that we are your one-stop shop for structural engineering services. We strive to provide you with solutions that will achieve your project’s schedule while meeting your cost or other complexity challenges. Our in-depth knowledge and experience make us industry leaders and your best choice for structural engineering. Why a Fully Operational Fire Suppression System Matters

All commercial kitchens produce oil, grease, and high levels of dry heat, which means that a breakout of fire is always a possibility. A single flame or spark can cause thousands of dollars in damage, and lead to injury or worse. The best risk-aversion strategy is to ensure all your appliances are equipped with the best fire protection system your money can buy.  The good news is that the best and most fully capable fire suppression equipment doesn’t have to break the bank. Hood Builder has your appliances, enterprise, staff, and customers fully covered with top-rated systems and installation you can always trust.

The Fire Suppression Equipment You Need 

We can install fire alarm systems, smoke detectors, fire sprinkler systems, corrosion detection systems, and clean agent systems. Whether you are replacing your old system, or you require a new fire suppression system install, Hood Builder can accommodate you. 

Fire Suppression Installations

Hood Builder stands behind every fire suppression installation we perform. For over 25 years, we have prided ourselves on only hiring the best installation and service technicians, and of course, we only work with top-rated equipment that will never let you down. Not only do we guarantee a quality installation every time but ask about our warranties and how we can keep your fire suppression working long into the future for ultimate peace of mind. 

Reliable Fire Suppression Equipment Repair 

You never want to wait when it comes to repairing a faulty fire suppression system. The moment a component malfunctions, contact Hood Builder and our service technicians will show up fast to ensure your fire suppression system is ready to respond the moment it’s needed.

Regular Maintenance Service

Do you know if your fire suppression system is working properly? The last time to discover that your system is out of whack is when a dangerous flame rears its ugly head. We can provide you with ongoing fire suppression maintenance services to assess the responsiveness of your fire suppression system and repair any components that may be defective for fire protection that always lasts. 

Buckeye Fire Suppression Systems

Hood Builder offers the Buckeye Kitchen Mister™ System to safeguard your kitchen and its staff against the risk of fire. The solution uses innovative misting technology to effectively put out the fire in the initial stage. In commercial kitchens where grease fire poses the risk of fire, these fire protection systems respond swiftly and contain the fire before it becomes dangerous.

Ansul Systems 

Widely acclaimed for its state-of-the-art technology, the Ansul fire suppression system is a robust solution to shield the commercial kitchen environment against various fire hazards. The system uses a liquid chemical agent called Ansulex to rapidly stop fire, cool hot surfaces and block re-ignition. Hood Builder deals in and specializes in the precise installation of Ansul products.

Pyrochem Fire Systems  

We deal in Pyrochem Kitchen Knight II, one of the leading fire protection systems best suited for a wide range of commercial kitchens. Apart from being used in the commercial business sector, it is also widely installed in industrial applications where the risk of fire is high. It has comprehensive potential to deal with vent hood and grease fire in a swift and responsive manner.

Amerex Fire Suppression Installations 

Amerex has gained international recognition for ensuring a fire-free environment in commercial kitchens. Its pre-engineered automatic gas detection and fire suppression system is ideal for large kitchens in restaurants, diners, catering facilities, schools, hotels, cruise ships etc.

Range Guard Systems 

Keep your commercial kitchen protected from fires at all times with range guard systems for all types of appliances and commercial kitchen layouts. From flexible pipe configurations and factory-filled pressure cylinders to nozzle swivel adaptors and pressure gauge valves, our systems have everything you need to keep your enterprise, staff, and customers safe. 

Call for Fire Suppression Installation You Can Trust

Hood Builder is the leader in fire suppression equipment and installations for the areas of Denver, Colorado. Call today to learn more about keeping your commercial kitchen safe from fire and we’ll provide you with a free and fast quote.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column offset="vc_col-lg-offset-1 vc_col-lg-4 vc_col-md-offset-1 vc_col-md-4"][vc_wp_custommenu nav_menu="14" el_class="wps-sidebar-related-links" title="Related Links"][templatera id="192"][/vc_column][vc_column][ultimate_spacer height="90" height_on_mob_landscape="70" height_on_mob="70"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width="wps-full-width"][vc_column][templatera id="96"][/vc_column][/vc_row]

What is Air Balancing?

The air in every building, whether it’s a large commercial facility, hospital, or private family home, has a positive or negative air pressure. Because of various factors, including infrastructural issues within the HVAC system, the presence of too many electric and electronic devices (stoves/TVs/computer monitors) or even the furniture placement in the room, airflow can become unbalanced. Air balancing is a service that seeks to correct this problem, making the HVAC (Heating, Ventilation and Air Conditioning systems) in the building or home more efficient and the room climate more comfortable.

Free Quote (303-777-7720)

 

Air Balancing (Defined)

HVAC air balancing optimizes the HVAC system to best ensure that air becomes evenly distributed throughout a building. This involves inspecting all elements of the system, cleaning ducts, replacing or refitting ducts and dampers. Beyond visual inspection of these elements, air balancing also involves testing, adjusting, and balancing services. A series of tests is performed that determines the problem areas  in each home/building. This allows Certified Air Balance technicians to fix/modify the elements of HVAC that are causing the issue, thus balancing airflow. The result is a building with improved, cleaner air quality, less temperature dips and highs, no hot/cold spots, and doors that are neither too hard to open (negative air) or drafty and open (excess positive air).

Why Air Balancing?

Oftentimes, unbalanced airflow is a silent problem that the owners of the home or business are not aware of, except for rising AC and heating bills. When left unattended, this can cost thousands of dollars per year. If there is too much positive air in a room, it will pull outside air in, which can cause the building to become too hot or too cold, depending on the weather. The people inside adjust the thermostat to compensate for the inconsistent temperature, producing a very costly energy inefficiency that is so easily preventable with the help of Certified Air Balancing. On the other hand, when there is too much negative air, the room will suck air from window and door cracks, trash bins, etc. creating an unpleasant air quality inside the building. This taxes the HVAC system as it struggles to filter the air. Eventually, the excessive harmful particles sucked up in a negative building will overwhelm the system, allowing unfiltered air to circulate, jeopardizing the health of its occupants. When an unbalanced airflow in a building becomes apparent, it can cause great discomfort and annoyance to the people within. In a home, this means an unwelcoming atmosphere for its occupants, and for a business, this can precipitate falling employee morale and productivity.

HVAC System Performance and Air Balancing

Every building is equipped with a Heating, Ventilation and Air Conditioning system, and that system needs to be tested for proper and optimal performance prior to use and throughout its lifespan. An extensive battery of tests examining various aspects of a building’s HVAC system is necessary to understanding your HVAC system performance thoroughly.

HVAC Air Balancing & Testing.

Tests done by certified air balancing professionals determine HVAC system performance by looking individually at: energy use and its efficiency, air purification testing (examines indoor air quality) and airflow testing. An unbalanced pressure buildup in a building will negatively affect the performance of all HVAC system functions and vice versa. A deficiency in the infrastructure of the HVAC system will contribute to uneven distribution of air throughout the home or business building. This is why it’s important to perform air balance adjustments with a trusted company.

Common Causes of Airflow Problems Fixed by Air Balance Adjustments

  • Missing dampers:

    Dampers are plates that open and close to direct air towards or away from specified sections of the building to accommodate the needs of different zones (rooms/levels). When they are missing, air is distributed incorrectly, causing temperature inconsistencies.

  • Restrictive ducts:

    Air ducts made with the wrong material create air friction and turbulence. Fittings of a tight elbow shape make airflow harder, forcing the HVAC system to work overtime to push air through.

  • Duct leakage:

    The integrity of the material of the ducts and the connective fittings can greatly affect airflow. Brittle materials with no flex allow breaks to happen; rodents can chew through ducts, creating holes. Huge amounts of conditioned air can be lost through leaking ducts, causing energy inefficiency.

  • Blower problems:

    When the blower fan is damaged, there is no steady pushing of air to be cooled or heated. Slow airflow through the ducts taxes the HVAC system.

  • Restrictive coils and filters:

    Dust, grease, dirt and other contaminants can clog up the condenser coil of the cooling system, causing decreased airflow. Dirty filters can also cause air friction, contributing to turbulence within the ducts and making airflow much slower.

Certified Air Balancing

Certified Air Balancing is Air Balancing performed by trained, accredited and certified air balancing professionals. Air balancing can be attempted by general handymen but is an art form best left to certified air balancing technicians that have completed the Testing, Adjusting and Balancing Certification Program. Certified Air Balancing is done by technicians that have been approved by NEBB or similar accrediting body, passing examinations issued by their accrediting institution as well as having completed a certain amount of working/supervising hours. HVAC firms applying for certified status must have a  senior technician on staff who checks, approves, and signs off on all air balancing jobs. This individual must pass a certified professional written exam as well as a report review exam. The certified testing engineers must have 8 years of air balancing experience or an engineering degree with 4 years of on the job experience. They have to oversee various aspects within their company–instrument calibration, technician training, and safety. They also must also submit their company’s standard operating procedures to NEBB to incur certification for their company. Individual contractors seeking certification must pass rigorous testing and complete two years of hands-on training to achieve certification.

WHY CHOOSE A CERTIFIED AIR BALANCING CONTRACTOR

While air balancing prior to the opening of a new building at the end of construction is somewhat simpler, service calls to homes and older buildings with deteriorating infrastructure require something more.  Education, intuition, and experience are necessary for this more complicated kind of job. This is why choosing a professional certified in air balancing, testing, and reporting is so important. Certified Air Balancing technicians are experts at troubleshooting irregular ductwork problems as well as cleaning and repairing aging HVAC elements. They also usually have the full range of tools necessary to test and adjust even the most challenging airflow problem, as opposed to HVAC generalists.

Commercial Air Balancing Certification Program

Individual contractors can seek air balance certification through several available courses. The International Training Institute (ITI) of Sheet Metal and Air Conditioning Industry offers various training options over the course of either one or two years. The Testing, Adjusting and Balancing Bureau initiated the TABB certification, which sets a standard for HVAC companies and individual contractors seeking to specialize in air balancing. All companies vying for TABB certified status must have at least one person on staff who has passed all written tests and is in good standing with NEBB. Individuals with TABB certification must have at least several years of experience performing and supervising air balancing services as well as having passed the examinations. The central bodies offering certification in air balancing to HVAC/ air balancing companies are the National Environmental Balancing Bureau (NEBB), the National Comfort Institute, The Associated Air Balancing Council, and the National Balancing Council. Commercial Air Balancing Certification prepares technicians for inspecting commercial buildings and testing the performance of the HVAC systems therein. This involves sealing off the building, closing dampers at each opening, adjusting them, and measuring airflow. When balanced airflow is achieved, the settings are locked in for optimal function. Certified technicians can do the initial adjustments as well as skillfully service older systems that need to have their ducts, coils and other elements inspected/repaired. Because they are knowledgeable about the hows and the whys of various HVAC system problems, they are able to efficiently troubleshoot to find the root problems instead of providing band aid solutions that eventually wear down the system. Hiring a professional for the job will save the customer money and prolong the life of their heating, ventilation and conditioning system.
